fields.name: location_information_header
fields.content: 1. Your property

fields.name: location_why
fields.content:
At the end of this survey you will be able to hide your contact information and location information or voluntarily choose to make it public for the VSP report.

If you own multiple properties within one of the Watershed Analysis Unit we only need one report from you, since we will be reporting Stewardship Actions by Watershed Analysis Units. If you have additional properties in another Watershed Analysis Unit please submit a second report so that we can capture Stewardship Actions by the correct Watershed Analysis Unit.

fields.name: drag_map_info
fields.content: If you own multiple properties within one of the Watershed Analysis Unit we only need one report from you, since we will be reporting Stewardship Actions by Watershed Analysis Units. If you have additional properties in another Watershed Analysis Unit please submit a second report so that we can captured Stewardship Actions by the correct Watershed Analysis Unit.

fields.name: address
fields.prompt: Search by address
fields.placeholder: Your address will never be shared

fields.name: analysis_units_header
fields.content: 2. Watershed analysis unit

fields.name: analysis_unit
fields.prompt: Of the three VSP watershed analysis units on map (Rock, Palouse, or Snake), which unit primarily represents your farm or ranch?  All reporting for VSP will be at the watershed analysis unit scale level. Complete multiple surveys for areas that are distinctly different.

fields.name: wetlands_header
fields.content: 3. Wetland areas

fields.name: wetlands_information
fields.content:
Description

Wetland areas are inundated or saturated by surface water or groundwater.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wetlands
fields.prompt: Are there any wetlands? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: frequently_flooded_header
fields.content: 4. Frequently flooded areas

fields.name: frequently_flooded_information
fields.content:
Description

Frequently flooded areas are subject to a 1% or greater chance of flooding every year.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_frequently_flooded
fields.prompt: Are there any frequently flooded areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: geologic_hazard_header
fields.content: 5. Severe geologic hazard areas

fields.name: geologic_hazard_information
fields.content:
Description

Severe geologic hazard areas are susceptible to erosion, sliding, earthquakes, and other events.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_geologic_hazard
fields.prompt: Are there any severe geologic hazard areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: critical_aquifer_header
fields.content: 6. Critical aquifer recharge areas

fields.name: critical_aquifer_information
fields.content:
Description

Critical aquifer recharge areas have a critical effect on aquifers used for potable water.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_critical_aquifer
fields.prompt: Are there any critical aquifer recharge areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: wildlife_conservation_header
fields.content: 7. Fish & wildlife conservation areas

fields.name: wildlife_conservation_information
fields.content:
Description

Fish & wildlife conservation areas are managed to maintain populations of fish and wildlife.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wildlife_conservation
fields.prompt: Are there any fish & wildlife conservation areas? Please note locations are approximate.

fields.name: additional_info_header
fields.content: 14. Almost completed!

fields.name: additional_info
fields.content:
Thank you for taking the time to voluntarily report your stewardship practices.

This page will determine how your information is shared. We will report all practices at the watershed analysis unit scale, but if you are interested in having your project showcased you can give us permission below. Either way, we will be using your stewardship practice to capture how agriculture is protecting and/or restoring critical areas and maintaining the viability of agriculture.

fields.name: my_image
fields.prompt: Show your stewardship practices! Upload photos before, during, or after you implemented your stewardship practices:
fields.label: Upload photos

fields.name: practices_description
fields.prompt: Add a description of your stewardship practices!

fields.name: private-landowner_name
fields.placeholder: Your name will only be shared if you are logged in
fields.prompt: What is your name?

fields.name: private-use_photos
fields.prompt: Can Whitman County VSP highlight your photos on our website?

fields.name: private
fields.prompt: Would you be willing to share your stewardship story with the public? Checking "yes" below will place a pin on the map upon submission and your stewardship actions will be visible to the public.

fields.name: private-landowner_email
fields.placeholder: Your email address will never be shared
fields.prompt: What is your email address?

fields.name: private-landowner_phone
fields.prompt: What is your phone number?
fields.placeholder: Your phone number will never be shared

fields.name: learned_about_vsp_map
fields.prompt: How did you find out about the Whitman County VSP map? Please check all that apply:

content: Your Whitman County VSP Coordinators or Whitman County Cattlemen’s, Wheat Growers or Farm Bureau are here to help meet your stewardship goals.
Contact a local VSP Coordinator and/or Grower Group or for more information visit: www.whitmancountyvsp.com.

Welcome Whitman County Voluntary Stewards!

Get Started

Whitman County Voluntary Stewardship Program (VSP) provides an innovative approach for reporting the protection of critical areas on agriculture lands that enhance our environment through voluntary measures, while promoting agriculture viability. VSP voluntarily collects previous and on-going stewardship data from all interested landowners, which helps document VSP participation and the importance of agriculture viability.
Help promote Whitman County agriculture by sharing stewardship strategies!
VSP success relies on voluntary participation by landowners!
Whitman County VSP appreciates your time sharing stewardship practices!
